The code `payer` SHALL have the display "Payer"
The code `payer` SHALL have the definition "A healthcare payer."
The code `atyprv` SHALL have the display "Atypical Provider"
The code `atyprv` SHALL have the definition "Providers that do not provide healthcare"
The code `bus` SHALL have the display "Non-Healthcare Business"

The 'endpoint' search parameter SHALL use the 'Location.endpoint' search expression.

Location resources SHALL include an `accessibility` extension with a code from the `http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/CodeSystem/AccessibilityCS` CodeSystem.
Location.telecom SHALL include a `contactpoint-availabletime` extension.
If the `contactpoint-availabletime` extension is present, it SHALL include at least one `daysOfWeek` extension with a valueCode indicating the day of the week.
If the `contactpoint-availabletime` extension is present, it MAY include an `allDay` extension with a valueBoolean indicating if the contact point is available all day.

... [Servers SHALL support] the 'contains' search modifier for the 'name' search parameter.

The HealthcareService resource SHALL include a 'delivery-method' extension.
The 'delivery-method' extension SHALL contain a 'type' extension.
The 'type' extension SHALL have a valueCodeableConcept with a coding element from the 'DeliveryMethodCS' code system.
The 'type' extension SHALL have a valueCodeableConcept with a coding element with the code 'virtual'.
The 'delivery-method' extension SHALL contain one or more 'virtualModalities' extensions.
Each 'virtualModalities' extension SHALL have a valueCodeableConcept with a coding element from the 'VirtualModalitiesCS' code system.
Each 'virtualModalities' extension SHALL have a valueCodeableConcept with a coding element with one of the following codes: 'web', 'app', 'tdd', 'phone'.
The HealthcareService resource SHALL have the 'active' element set to 'true'.
The HealthcareService resource SHALL include a 'category' element.
The 'category' element SHALL have a coding element from the 'HealthcareServiceCategoryCS' code system.
The 'category' element SHALL have a coding element with the code 'prov'.
The HealthcareService resource SHALL include a 'specialty' element.
The 'specialty' element SHALL have a coding element from the 'provider-taxonomy' code system.
The 'specialty' element SHALL have a coding element with the code '101YP2500X'.
HealthcareService resources SHALL include the `delivery-method` extension.
The `delivery-method` extension SHALL have an extension with url `type`.
The `type` extension SHALL have a valueCodeableConcept with a coding containing the delivery method.
The delivery method code SHALL be taken from the `http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/CodeSystem/DeliveryMethodCS` code system.
HealthcareService resources SHALL include the `newpatients` extension.
The `newpatients` extension SHALL have an extension with url `acceptingPatients`.
The `acceptingPatients` extension SHALL have a valueCodeableConcept with a coding containing the accepting patients code.
The accepting patients code SHALL be taken from the `http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/CodeSystem/AcceptingPatientsCS` code system.
The `newpatients` extension SHALL have an extension with url `fromNetwork`.
The `fromNetwork` extension SHALL have a valueReference pointing to the Organization resource representing the network.
HealthcareService resources SHALL include the `via-intermediary` extension within the telecom element.
The `via-intermediary` extension SHALL have a valueReference pointing to the Organization resource representing the intermediary.
HealthcareService.category SHALL be coded using the `http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/CodeSystem/HealthcareServiceCategoryCS` code system.
Servers SHALL support searching using the chained parameters [name] and [partof].
The search parameter [owned-by] SHALL be of type [reference].
The search parameter [owned-by] SHALL search on the [InsurancePlan.ownedBy] element.
The search parameter [owned-by] SHALL support searching for multiple OR values.
The search parameter [owned-by] SHALL support searching for multiple AND values.
The search parameter [owned-by] SHALL have a target resource type of [Organization].
The 'address-city' search parameter SHALL be of type 'string'.
The 'address-city' search parameter SHALL use the 'Location.address.city' FHIRPath expression to filter search results.
Servers SHALL support the 'exact' modifier on the 'address-city' search parameter.
Servers SHALL support the 'contains' modifier on the 'address-city' search parameter.
Servers SHALL support searching for Location resources with multiple 'address-city' search parameters combined using OR logic (i.e., at least one of the provided 'address-city' values must match).
Servers SHALL support searching for Location resources with multiple 'address-city' search parameters combined using AND logic (i.e., all of the provided 'address-city' values must match).
Clients [...] that cache query results can track additions or modifications to directory content through queries that filter content using the _lastUpdated search parameter.
URL: Client Detection of Updates Directory Content

Requirement: Clients should periodically check that data cached from past queries has not been deleted by querying for the same elements by _id.
URL: Client Detection of Updates Directory Content

Requirement: It is important for payers to use the Plan-Net profiles consistently in order to achieve true interoperability of directory information among payers.
URL: Representing and Searching Provider Directory Data

Requirement: The intent of this section is to provide examples of the canonical use of the profiles provided in this IG that will guide implementers towards the consistent use of these profiles that will enable 3rd party applications to search the data.
URL: Representing and Searching Provider Directory Data

Requirement: each provider's service [MUST] be supported by appropriate set of HealthcareService instances
HealthcareServices are typically provided by an organization
HealthcareServices [MAY] be linked to a set of locations where service is provided
HealthcareServices [MAY] be identified as virtual services through an indicated set of virtual modalities
All organizations that provide service should define an appropriate set of HealthcareServices to facilitate search.
A healthcare provider insurance network is an aggregation of organizations and individuals that deliver a set of services across a geography through health insurance products/plans.
A network is typically owned by a payer.
In the PlanNet IG, individuals [...] are represented as participants in a [...] Network through the practitionerRole [...] resource.
In the PlanNet IG, organizations are represented as participants in a [...] Network through the [...] Plan-Net-organizationAffiliation resources.
An organization is a formal or informal grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose, such as a company, institution, corporation, community group, or healthcare practice.

The OrganizationAffiliation resource describes relationships between two or more organizations, including the services one organization provides another, the location(s) where they provide services, the availability of those services, electronic endpoints, and other relevant information.
Practitioner is a person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare.
Payers SHALL use the fixed filename `location-address-postalcode` for the Location Address Postal Code search parameter file.
URL: Change History/PDEX Payer Network Implementation Guide/Changes Since v1.0.0 (paragraph 1)

Requirement: Payers SHALL use the fixed filename `location-address-state` for the Location Address State search parameter file.
URL: Change History/PDEX Payer Network Implementation Guide/Changes Since v1.0.0 (paragraph 1)

Requirement: Payers SHALL update taxonomy codes according to Jira tickets FHIR-33206, FHIR-31494 to FHIR-31499.
URL: Change History/PDEX Payer Network Implementation Guide/Changes Since v1.0.0 (paragraph 2)

Requirement: Systems implementing this capability statement should meet the CMS Final Rule requirement for provider directory access.
